title: The Grand Tour season 4 fans fuming over episode count
text:
The Grand Tour season four is around the corner (Picture: Amazon)

The Grand Tour fans are devastated that the upcoming fourth season will consist of just two episodes and have branded the move ‘terrible’.

Executive producer Andy Wilman confirmed that viewers will only be getting a double dose of Jeremy Clarkson, James May and Richard Hammond in the forthcoming series due to a format overhaul.

Gone will be the days of the track and celebrity guests and instead, each offering will be a much larger scale of production.

‘First one’s Christmas. Then the next one will be Spring,’ Andy told Grand Tour Nation.

‘Basically at the minute it’s a bit loose. We give them to Amazon and they put them out when they want to.

‘This one at the minute is an hour and three quarters. It was two hours and a quarter when I did my first cut.’

The new series looks set to be only two episodes (Picture: Amazon)

Disgruntled viewers have aired their grievances with the changes on Reddit and it’s clear that they’re a little bit miffed.

‘This is absolutely terrible!’ complained user Qosclca. ‘I was so excited when I heard they were just making specials from now on, thinking that meant we’d be getting a season of specials – instead of just two specials a year.

‘So now that they’ve cut all of the other content, they’re making – two specials a year?’

They added: ‘I used to excitedly wait all year long for a season of The Grand Tour. Now I have to wait all that time for two specials…’

Echoing a similar sentiment fickfackfu wrote: ‘I’m really very disappointed now. I know the specials are much work, but I thought they would at least make six or eight, maybe two big ones and some smaller ones like China or the Georgia trips from season 3.

‘Meh. Better than nothing but come on… just two?’

Let’s not forget though that Jeremy has got his own Amazon show I Bought The Farm and Richard has got Richard Hammond’s Big over on Discovery.

Meanwhile, James is also going solo with his Amazon project Our Man In… Japan set to launch next year.

The Grand Tour season 4 is expected to land on Amazon Prime Video later this year.
